skill.name: ensembl-database
skill.description: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant analysis, comparative genomics, orthologs, VEP predictions, for genomic research.
skill.summary: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant a...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill provides legitimate access to the Ensembl genomics database REST API. All detected patterns are false positives. The backtick patterns flagged as Ruby shell execution are actually Markdown code blocks in documentation files. The Cobalt Strike and weak crypto patterns are generic terms in API documentation that have no malicious context. The Python script contains only standard HTTP requests to official Ensembl endpoints with proper rate limiting.

low_findings.description: Script makes HTTP requests to Ensembl REST API endpoints
low_findings.recommendation: This is expected behavior for a genomics database query skill. All requests go to official rest.ensembl.org domains.

content.user_title: Query Ensembl genome database for 250+ species
content.value_statement: Genomic researchers need access to gene sequences, variants, and comparative data across species. This skill queries the Ensembl database REST API to retrieve gene information, DNA sequences, variant predictions, orthologs, and regulatory features for over 250 vertebrate species.
actual_capabilities: Query gene information by symbol or Ensembl ID across 250+ species
Retrieve DNA, transcript, and protein sequences in JSON or FASTA format
Predict variant consequences using Variant Effect Predictor VEP
Find orthologs and paralogs for comparative genomics analysis
Access regulatory features and genomic annotations for research
Convert coordinates between genome assemblies like GRCh37 to GRCh38
limitations: Rate limited to 15 requests per second for anonymous users
Only supports species available in Ensembl database release 115
Requires internet connection to access Ensembl REST API
Large batch queries may require registered API access for higher limits

use_cases.title: Gene variant impact analysis
use_cases.description: Predict functional consequences of genetic variants using VEP and retrieve population frequency data for clinical research

use_cases.title: Cross-species comparative genomics
use_cases.description: Find orthologs across species and compare gene structures to study evolutionary conservation and gene function

use_cases.title: Automated sequence retrieval pipeline
use_cases.description: Build pipelines that fetch DNA, transcript, or protein sequences for gene lists with proper rate limiting and error handling

prompt_templates.title: Look up gene information
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up the gene BRCA2 in humans and show me the Ensembl ID, chromosome location, and number of transcripts

prompt_templates.title: Get DNA sequence
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve the genomic DNA sequence for the gene TP53 in FASTA format and save it to a file

prompt_templates.title: Predict variant effects
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Variant Effect Predictor to analyze the variant rs699 and tell me the predicted functional consequences and affected genes

prompt_templates.title: Find orthologs across species
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all mouse orthologs for the human gene ENSG00000139618 and compare their protein sequences to identify conserved domains

output_examples.input: Look up the gene BRCA2 in humans

output: Clinical significance: Associated with hypertension susceptibility

output_examples.input: Find mouse orthologs for human BRCA2

best_practices: Respect API rate limits of 15 requests per second and implement exponential backoff for retries
Use batch endpoints when querying multiple genes or variants to reduce total API calls
Cache frequently accessed results locally to minimize redundant queries and improve performance
anti_patterns: Making rapid sequential API calls without rate limiting will trigger 429 errors and temporary blocks
Ignoring HTTP error codes like 404 can lead to incorrect assumptions about gene or variant existence
Querying GRCh37 data using the main API endpoint instead of grch37.rest.ensembl.org returns wrong results

faq.question: Which species are supported by this skill?
faq.answer: Over 250 vertebrate species from Ensembl release 115 including human, mouse, zebrafish, and many model organisms. Query info/species endpoint for full list.

faq.question: How do I query older human genome assembly GRCh37?
faq.answer: Use the grch37.rest.ensembl.org base URL instead of rest.ensembl.org for all GRCh37 or hg19 queries. The script supports this via assembly parameter.

faq.question: What is the rate limit for the Ensembl API?
faq.answer: Anonymous users can make 15 requests per second. Registered users get 55,000 requests per hour. The included script handles rate limiting automatically.

faq.question: Can I retrieve protein sequences with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, use the sequence endpoint with type parameter set to protein. You can also get genomic, cds, and cdna sequences in JSON or FASTA format.

faq.question: How do I predict the effect of a genetic variant?
faq.answer: Use the Variant Effect Predictor VEP endpoints with either HGVS notation, variant ID like rs699, or genomic coordinates and allele information.

faq.question: Does this skill work offline or cache results?
faq.answer: No, it requires internet connection to query the live Ensembl REST API. You can add caching logic to your workflow to store frequently accessed results locally.
